qas.question: What class does materialism belong to?

plausible_answers.text: it is different from ontological theories based on dualism or pluralism

qas.question: Why does materialism belong in monist ontology?
Monist ontology is the same as dualism and what else?
Materialism is the same as idealism, neutral monism, and what else?

plausible_answers.text: singular explanations of the phenomenal reality

qas.question: What is the definition of neutral monism?

context: Materialism belongs to the class of <a0_0>monist ontology<a0_0/>. As such, <b1_0>it is different from ontological theories based on dualism or <b2_0><b5_0>pluralism<b5_0/><b2_0/><b1_0/>. For <b4_0>singular explanations of the phenomenal reality<b4_0/>, materialism would be in contrast to idealism, neutral monism, and <b3_0>spiritualism<b3_0/>.
